sentences.en: Drivers routinely  overtake on the right, taxis breeze through red lights, cyclists ride against the traffic and pedestrians jaywalk.
sentences.cn: 开车人常常从右侧超车，出租车闯红灯，骑自行车逆行，行人乱穿马路。

sentences.en: It is not uncommon for people to jaywalk.
sentences.cn: 人们任意穿越马路并非不常见.

sentences.en: Pedestrians have to travel farther to cross the street legally unless they want to jaywalk.
sentences.cn: 行人需要走远一点从斑马线上横过马路,除非他们想要乱穿马路.

words.tran_cn: 不守交通规则；乱穿马路的人

trans.tran_cn: 乱穿马路（不遵守交通规则）
trans.tran_en: to cross or walk in a street recklessly or illegally
